html:
Best Lip Mask

Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask

Pros

  • Velvety texture
  • A little goes a long way

Cons

  • Some may dislike scents

It’s probably no surprise to you that Laneige’s hero product made this list. Not only do ELLE editors hoard these lip sleeping masks like gold, but our experts love them, too. “Laneige’s Lip Sleeping Mask contains shea butter, antioxidants, and murumuru seed,” says Dr. Lin.” This Korean skin care product is very popular on social media and provides a great overnight leave-on option that comes in different flavors.” Dr. Nazarian agrees, adding that “it also has antioxidants to decrease inflammation, so skin feels calmer and less chapped quickly.”

Key ingredients: Vitamin C, murumuru, shea butter

Size: 0.7 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This stuff works! Winter is always rough on my lips, and this one was no different. Dry, flaky, and those annoying cracks that bleed after you move your lips just a little too much. Plus, I am a chronic lip biter and have a bad habit of licking them to moisten them. I tried the mask because my best friend uses it, and her lips always look amazing. It is important to mention that I was consistent and put it on every night after brushing my teeth and before bed. After three nights, I already felt a difference throughout the day at work and saw way fewer cracks. After a full seven nights with the product, my lips are so soft. No flakes, no cracks, no pain or embarrassment.”

Best Lip Exfoliator

Typology Resurfacing Lip Peel

Pros

  • Prevents lip cracking and chapping
  • Helps lips stay hydrated

Cons

  • May not be suitable for very sensitive skin

This is a cult-favorite French product that customers describe as “life-changing.” The formula features mandelic acid, a gentle chemical exfoliant, and fuses it with pomegranate enzymes to slough off dead skin cells and flakes without damaging the skin. However, Dr. Nazarian does warn that you should be careful when using a lip peel, no matter how great your lips feel afterward. “Use infrequently and sparingly to remove chapped, dead skin, then switch to a hydrating balm once you’ve exfoliated,” she says.

Key ingredients: Mandelic acid, pomegranate enzyme, trehalose

Size: 0.5 oz.

Typology rating: 4.1/5 stars

A Typology reviewer says: “This product is absolutely superb. I struggle with dry lips that flake and crack, and this exfoliates without making my lips feel raw. I finally have soft, moisturized lips.”

Best for Treating Damge

SkinCeuticals Antioxidant Lip Repair

Both of our experts also rave about the Skinceuticals Antioxidant Lip Repair, which boasts vitamin E, hyaluronic acid, and free radical-neutralizing antioxidants. “It’s designed to help hydrate the lips while combating environmental damage and signs of aging,” says Dr. Lin.

Key ingredients: Silymarin, vitamin E, hydroxyethyl urea, allantoin, hyaluronic acid

Size: 0.34 oz.

Dermstore rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Dermstore reviewer says: “I have sun damaged lips made worse by the dry climate in Colorado. I have tried multiple products but still suffered from chapped lips until I used this product. I actually noticed an improvement after the first day.”

Best Versatile Treatment

Clinique Moisture Surge Lip Hydro-Plump Treatment

Pros

  • Suitable for sensitive skin
  • Great for on-the-go

Clinique’s Moisture Surge moisturizer has a legion of loyal users, and the accompanying lip treatment deserves its laurels, too. “It’s fragrance-free and contains ingredients like shea butter and ceramides for hydration,” says Dr. Lin. You can apply a thin layer if you need some hydration during the day, but a thicker layer will also work as a nourishing lip mask at night.

Key ingredients: Lipids, shea butter, ceramides

Size: 0.34 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I have extremely sensitive skin, and a few years ago began reacting very badly to everything but plain old petroleum jelly. On recommendation from a friend, I tried this under a lip color for a wedding recently. It’s so soothing and didn’t harm me! I’ve since used it daily, and my lips are in gorgeous condition. No more flaking, peeling, swelling, pain. And we’re currently in cold arctic temps. It’s expensive but worth it for me. I put it on auto ship.”

Most Splurge-Worthy Lip Balm

U Beauty The Plasma Lip Compound

Pros

  • Virtually no scent
  • Plumping

Cons

  • Some may dislike taste

I’ve loved this lip balm since I first tried it, but I really began using it in earnest ever since Crown Affair founder Dianna Cohen told me that she keeps one on hand at all times. Everything from the soft-matte packaging to the metal applicator screams luxury. The formula instantly plumps my lips, erases fine lines, and makes it look like I’m wearing a gloss—without the icky sticky feeling of traditional glosses. It also comes in a variety of gorgeous colors that never disappoint.

Key ingredients: Peptides, AHA, ceramides, PHA, salicylic acid, shea butter, beeswax

Size: 0.5 oz.

U Beauty rating: 4.2/5 stars

A U Beauty reviewer says: “These colors are so beautiful. They make my lips look luscious and plump, and the splash of juicy color really wakes up my entire face. The peptides really hydrate my dry, dull pout, leaving it looking supple, seductive, and youthful. Love!”

Best Tinted Lip Balm

Eadem Le Chouchou

Pros

  • Cooling metal applicator
  • Stays on the lips

Cons

  • Some may dislike scent

If I were starting my lip collection from scratch, this liquid lip balm in the shade Boba Bounce would be one of the first items I’d pick up. First of all, it’s the perfect shade of brown and doubles as a gloss. But more importantly, the formula is an absolute gem; it’s cushiony, comfortable, and has deeply hydrating ingredients (Brazilian açaí butter and African mongongo butter) as well as flake-banishing exfoliants (hibiscus enzymes, lactic acid, and pyruvic acid). I’ve turned multiple friends onto the product, and none of them have regretted trying it.

Key ingredients: Brazilian açaí butter, African mongongo butter, hibiscus enzymes, lactic acid, pyruvic acid

Size: 4.3 oz.

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “This is the perfect lip balm. It feels so fancy. It tastes good. I hate wearing sticky lipgloss, and this is the perfect solution for that. This is perfect with a lip liner. Doesn't feel like lipgloss or lipstick at all. The color is also amazing and stays long after the balm wipes off. Literally replaced all my lip products—I wear it every day.”

Best for Hopelessly Dry Lips

Dr. Idriss Barrier Baste Lip Basting Duo

Pros

  • Travel-friendly
  • Products available separately as well

Cons

  • Some may dislike taste

If nothing else has helped, and you need a simple routine that’ll save your lips from an endless cycle of lip balm application and painful cracking, I’d recommend testing out dermatologist Dr. Shereene Idriss’s signature method: Lip basting. Basically, you go in with a gentle lip peel to get rid of any dead skin cells on the surface of your lips. Then, you replenish moisture by supplementing your skin’s moisture barrier with a thicker balm. Dr. Idriss recently launched this duo specifically designed for her technique.

Key ingredients: Mandelic acid, gluconolactone, squalane, ceramides

Size: 2 x 0.34 oz.

Dr. Idriss rating: 4.9/5 stars

A Dr. Idriss reviewer says: “I was hesitant this would work as well as I thought it did. I constantly apply Chapstick, lip gloss, etc. to make my lips feel hydrated, but nothing helps. This lip combo is effective at exfoliating and hydrating to make your lips feel very soft. This will now be a staple in my routine. Very impressed!”

Meet the Experts

How often should you use lip treatments?

It all depends on the product. “There are some that are overnight treatments, while others are designed to be used during the day when the lips are particularly dry,” says Dr. Lin. “In general, lip balms can be applied multiple times per day, but the lip treatments are typically not used as frequently.” For example, Dr. Nazarian recommends using more intense lip peels once a week, while you can use lip masks a little more often.

What are some other tried-and-true ways to prevent and treat dry lips?

According to Dr. Nazarian, some may benefit from installing a humidifier in the home in addition to drinking lots of water. “But I find that it can also be helpful to make sure you’re avoiding irritating and drying ingredients in your skin care regimen,” she adds. “Look for acne medications and retinoids, which are major culprits. Even drying, acne-targeting facial washes can strip moisture from lips, making them chapped over time.”

Dr. Lin also emphasizes the need for sun protection. Lips are often forgotten about during our daily sunscreen regimens, but the thin lips in the area need ample care, too. “SPF protection for the lips is also essential to avoid UV damage as this can worsen the texture and appearance over time,” she says.

Finally, both experts implore us to stop licking our lips. “Saliva destroys lips tissue and triggers chapping,” Dr. Nazarian explains.
